title: How important is reading real books for kids 4-14? - Quora

response.answer_text: I am not sure what real boojs mean. I DO know one of my most treasured cherished memories is Mom reading aloud to me and my siblings from about 4 to 12yo. If Harry Potter had been around during my teen years, I am sure Mom and I would have read them together. She often read us books above our reading levels. By the time I was 10, she had read us Sounder, Harriet the Spy, Watership Down, original Pooh books, Wind and the Willows, and more. I am an avid reader and know my vocab was above grade level as a result. My brother began reading the Harry Potter series to his daughter when she was 5yo. She had already taught herself to read in TK. (4 1/2). By the time she was 7yo she was “sneaking ahead" reading after bedtime…

For children with any kind of disability or learning problem, the sooner they can get the special help they need, the easier it will be for them to learn. At age 6, most first-graders can: Read and retell familiar stories. ... Decide on their own to use reading and writing for different purposes. Six-year-olds can count pretty high — often up to 200! This allows them to explore more math concepts, such as skip counting and place value. Your child will begin to study and apply these math concepts every week at school. Many 6-year-olds will begin or continue to develop independent reading and may begin to enjoy writing stories, especially about themselves. They may be able to write a short paragraph about what they did over summer vacation or a weekend, for instance.
